html:
7.31.17  4:23 pm   do you think people are, on average, more impulsive or thoughtful, before taking an action? base a conclusion on your questions page.
(asking a question being the 'action')

     i think you defined the 2 as being at opposite ends of a balanced spectrum. so the answer would have to be 50% of each, based on the way you framed the question

7.31.17  4:16 pm   what's your honest opinion on the whole "art is subjective" debate? i find myself changing opinion on that every once in a while, especially about music and film (which i know more about than painting or sculpture). of course, everyone can like what they like but i can't help but give more weight to experts like critics and other artists. for example, an average movie goer may like some film that Roger Ebert says is crap, and that's ok, but without watching the film i'm gonna believe Roger Ebert first. if Bill Wurtz (a multi instrumentalist with years of music behind his belt) says that  some piece is bad then that opinion holds more weight than if i said that. and even more so when you have a majority of experts agree with it. this has lead to a lot of dissonance where i feel ashamed when i like something, or even more ashamed when i dislike something that for example quentin tarantino says is a masterpiece. I just can't help but feel that an expe rts opinion even on art is more important than an average consumers opinion. Your thoughts?

     my strategy is to just try making some stuff and see what happens. i'm not sure if that answers your question

7.31.17  4:10 pm   if you would discover a fruit that was a little bit bigger than a grapefruit, and you wouldnt have to peel it because the skin would be thin and edible, and it would be pretty juicy and very sweet and also very sour tasting, maybe with some minty hint almost, and it would have tiny seeds, and the color would be lightgreen on the outside and pink/orange-ish on the inside,, what would you call it? 

     i'm not interested in naming fruits or vegetables unless i absolutely have to. thank you for the opportunity

7.31.17  2:46 pm   how do you make good motifs?

     just do something good, and hope someone calls it a motif

7.31.17  2:43 pm   I'm a jazz guitarist student and I hate playing chords that don't match with a pianist. I asked someone I trust about this and he suggested that I switch to bass. I'm kind of scared to do that because I will have to spend all this time to get good enough to play with others, but I'm not opposed to the instrument or anything... Okay. I will learn bass. Thank you Bill.

     having 2 chordal instruments in a band can potentially be tedious unless both players are keenly aware that they need to cooperate and listen very well, and perhaps even do a little planning in some cases, if the music hasn't already been tightly arranged. always be communicating/negotiating, 'you wanna take this' 'i'll take take that' 'what are you doing here' 'can we try this there' etc. just always check in with each other

7.31.17  9:13 am   Is there anything you like to do to motivate yourself/give yourself new ideas when you are bored? 

     there is a never ending surplus of work that needs to be done. boredom would be impossible. i try to motivate myself with the promise of results from doing the current project and/or future projects

7.30.17  11:39 pm   Do you believe Mirrors are actually windows to an alternate reality that is in all ways congruent to the one we reside in, and when we look in the mirror, ourselves look back?

And if that's the case, do you think that when a person flexed their muscles on the mirror, they are secretly conscious of this alternate realm and are trying to assert their dominance over their counterparts?

7.30.17  11:37 pm   Besides going to war, what are some other ways that countries can settle a conflict?

     threatening to go to war

7.30.17  11:34 pm   How do I break out of mind prison?

     using your mind. i know that might seem unexpected but it's true

7.30.17  11:08 pm   today my priest told an anecdote in his sermon about how when he was a youth pastor he would make the youth play "mixer games" and one of them was where he would give an either/or option like "Batman or Superman" and each option had a side of the room, so (i guess, although it's left a little ambiguous:) whichever side you were "for" or "liked more," you'd go to that side. and I was immediately like: that's bullshit. chocolate or vanilla? well, first of all, it depends entirely on the application. i usually like chocolate ice cream and cake but i often like vanilla cake with vanilla frosting. but that doesn't even scratch the surface of all possible or even probable dessert options that could include chocolate or vanilla. this is assuming we're talking about Desserts That I Would Like To Eat Right Now and not, say, Desserts I Would Give My Enemy (i'd give him whichever he liked least in that application), or Paint Colors For My Bathroom, which given such a restricted choice I guess I'd have to go with vanilla. but like, what kind of fascist horseshit government am i living under that only allows brown and off-white (or maybe black, if you're talking about the actual color of a vanilla bean) as bathroom colors? after going through the other three examples of random dichotomies he gave my mind started itching from the inside and i realized that ten minutes had gone by and i'd missed half of an interesting sermon on predestination, which most people think is when God takes people's souls before they're born and puts them on either the Heaven side of the room or the Hell side of the room. (but i think his point was that it's not really like that.) and i didnt even think about "bill wurtz" until i was conscious of the brain itch but when i was i just smiled a little bit and thought i'd tell you about it.

     wow, you shredded the "thing or thing" question. nice job. i think the "thing or thing" question is actually part of a divide and conquer strategy
7.30.17  11:04 pm   Which one of your videos do you think describes you the best?

7.30.17  10:00 pm   Are the things listed at the end of 'what is love?' (i LOVE moms, i LOVE the beach, i LOVE electronics, etc) things that you personally love, or they just examples of things that a person could theoretically love?

     examples of things you could love
